name: Totchos Libre
author: The Gruntled Gourmand
summary: As Napoleon Dynamite instructed us: It's time to go find our own tots! Free yourself from the tried-and-true tortilla chip and wow everyone at your next Taco Tuesday with this delicious variation using Tater Tots®! Totchos Libre!
ingredients: 1 (32 ounce) package frozen bite-size potato nuggets (such as Tater Tots®)
½ cup fresh jalapeno pepper slices
1  avocado - peeled, pitted, and cut into chunks
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Spread potato nuggets out onto a baking sheet
Bake in the preheated oven until nuggets are golden brown and crisp, 22 to 24 minutes
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes
Add water and   to beef; bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer until liquid reduces, about 5 minutes
Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
Arrange potato nuggets on an oven-proof platter and cover evenly with ground beef; spread Mexican cheese and pepperjack cheese over the top
Cook potato nuggets under the broiler until cheese melts, 1 to 3 minutes
Whisk sour cream and lime juice together in a bowl
Top potato nuggets with tomatoes, black olives, jalapenos, avocado, sour cream mixture, scallions, and cilantro, respectively
